snippet: François Hollande became the first Socialist president of France since 1981, but his victory over Nicolas Sarkozy will also be seen as a challenge to the policy of austerity in the euro zone.
abstract: Francois Hollande defeats French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, becoming the first Socialist elected president of France since Francois Mitterand; Sarkozy becomes the latest European leader to lose his post amid economic upheaval and the first French incumbent to be rejected since 1981. Photos (M)

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER; Reporting was contributed by Maïa de la Baume in Tulle, France, and Scott Sayare, Elvire Camus, Palko Karasz, Eleanor Stanford, Roswana Khan and Meghan Davidson in Paris

lead_paragraph: PARIS -- François Hollande defeated President Nicolas Sarkozy on Sunday, becoming the first Socialist elected president of France since François Mitterrand. Mr. Hollande campaigned on a gentler and more inclusive France, but his victory will also be seen as a challenge to the German-dominated vision of economic austerity as a way out of the euro crisis. Mr. Sarkozy became the latest European leader to lose his post amid economic upheaval and the first French incumbent to be rejected since 1981.

headline.main: Socialist Wins French Election Against Sarkozy
